intro: Forsteronia prancei, commonly known as the Prance's forsteronia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
